item.title: Future ibot
item.dc:creator: @ruler ruler
item.description:
@ruler wrote:

public Point[] Path(int x0, int y0, int x1, int y1) {
		double ThetaInc;
		ArrayList<Point> Controls = new ArrayList<Point>(0);
		int dx = x1 - x0;
		int dy = y1 - y0;
		int dist = (int) Math.sqrt(Math.pow((dx), 2) + Math.pow((dy), 2));
		int pts = (int) dist / SettingsManager.mouseFrequency;
		int x, y, x_random, y_random, temp_random;
		Controls.add(new Point(x0, y0));
		for (int i = 1; i < pts; i++) {
			if (i - 1 == pts) {
				x_random = 0;
				y_random = 0;
				x = x1;
				y = y1;
			} else {
				x = x0 + i * dx / pts;
				y = y0 + i * dy / pts;
				if (x == 0) {
					x_random = 0;
				} else if ((SettingsManager.maxX - x) > x) {
					x_random = random(0, x);
				} else {
					if ((SettingsManager.maxX - x) < 1) {
						x_random = 0;
					} else {
						x_random = random(0, SettingsManager.maxX - x);
					}
				}
				if (y == 0) {
					y_random = 0;
				} else if ((SettingsManager.maxY - y) > y) {
					y_random = random(0, SettingsManager.maxY);
				} else {
					if ((SettingsManager.maxY - y) < 1) {
						y_random = 0;
					} else {
						y_random = random(0, SettingsManager.maxY - y);
					}
				}
				temp_random = random(0, 2);
				if (temp_random == 1) {
					y_random *= -1;
				}
			}
			Controls.add(new Point(x + x_random, y + y_random));
		}
		Controls.add(new Point(x1, y1));
		ThetaInc = 1 / ((Math.sqrt(Math.pow((x0 - x1), 2)
				+ Math.pow((y0 - y1), 2))) / 5);
		return MakeSplinePath(Controls.toArray(new Point[0]), ThetaInc);
	}

	private int Fract(int number) {
		int temp = 1;
		if (number != 0) {
			for (int i = 1; i <= number; i++) {
				temp *= i;
			}
		}
		return temp;
	}

	private int BinCoe(int a, int b) {
		if ((b >= 0) && (b <= a)) {
			int x = Fract(a);
			int y = Fract(b);
			int z = Fract(a - b);
			if ((y * z) != 0) {
				return (x / (y * z));
			}
		}
		return 1;
	}

	/**
	 * @author Orignally by Benland100
	 * 
	 * heavily modified
	 */
	private Point GetSplinePt(Point[] Controls, double Theta) {
		int n = Controls.length - 1;
		double xTemp = 0, yTemp = 0;
		for (int i = 0; i <= n; i++) {
			xTemp = xTemp
					+ (BinCoe(n, i) * Controls[i].x
							* Math.pow((1 - Theta), (n - i)) * Math.pow(Theta,
							i));
			yTemp = yTemp
					+ (BinCoe(n, i) * Controls[i].y
							* Math.pow((1 - Theta), (n - i)) * Math.pow(Theta,
							i));
		}
		return new Point((int) xTemp, (int) yTemp);
	}

	private Point[] MakeSplinePath(Point[] Controls, double ThetaInc) {
		double t = 0;
		Point temp;
		Point last = new Point();
		ArrayList<Point> result = new ArrayList<Point>(1);
		while (t <= 1) {
			temp = GetSplinePt(Controls, t);
			if (!temp.equals(last)) {
				result.add(temp);
				last = temp;
			}
			t += ThetaInc;
		}
		temp = GetSplinePt(Controls, 1);
		if (!temp.equals(last)) {
			result.add(temp);
			last = temp;
		}
		return result.toArray(new Point[0]);
	}

is the rest i believe
i dont remember all my changes, most of them keep the mouse on the applet. But now it is ok to move it on and off the applet because i now implement mouse exit / mouse enter events.

int pts = (int) dist / SettingsManager.mouseFrequency;

keep in mind i wrote this months ago.
from the reading the code it appears basically it draws a line from the start to the end then it adds points above or below that line at random(0, the max disance to the edge of the applet)

basically it should instead try to randomize from it last position and toward the end point instead of starting from the line for each point.

If you think this is confusing wait till you see:

/**
	 * 
	 * This method returns all the Valid XY's from a color Array That are within
	 * the tolerances of the RGB. Max of 1000 matches returned.
	 * 
	 * @author Eric
	 * @param colorArray2d
	 *            the colors of the game screen sorted as int's in an array
	 *            [x][y]
	 * @param bounds
	 *            The Rectange to search, specifies which part of the
	 *            colorArray2d to search
	 * @param ignore
	 *            The Rectangles to ignore in the search, specifies which parts
	 *            of the bounds to ignore, example searching game screen but
	 *            ignoring your character
	 * @param bitmapArray2d
	 *            A bitmap [x][y] array, That can contain a BITMASK, a color
	 *            array or both.
	 * @param redTolerance
	 *            The maximum difference for the red color value
	 * @param greenTolerance
	 *            The maximum difference for the green color value
	 * @param blueTolerance
	 *            The maximum difference for the blue color value
	 * @return An array of XY matches or null if none found
	 */
	protected XY[] findXYs(int[][] colorArray2d, Rectangle bounds,
			Rectangle ignore[], int[][] bitmapArray2d, int redTolerance,
			int greenTolerance, int blueTolerance) {

[br][size=1]Posted at: August 10, 2006, 12:52:15 AM[/size][hr][quote=“Bebemycat2, post:22, topic:8802”]What version of the spline mouse movments are you using? The one from SRL? Or that onld Java version Ben released back on kait’s forums?[/quote]

item.title: Future ibot
item.dc:creator: @ruler ruler
item.description:
@ruler wrote:

[quote=“Pwnd, post:19, topic:8802”]Ruler, talk to semaphore about a mouse movement algorithm. I doubt he’ll give you the whole thing (RichyT was supplied with the algorithm; part anyways).

Why would you unrename? Are you editting those classes? Make two copies and keep one original.[/quote]
unrenames so that class “map” is refering to the correct names/fields in the orignal client.

[quote=“Bebemycat2”]Ruler, I can make you a better Spline path in SCAR then I guess you can convert it to Java for your use.

Pwnd, about the arching, if you read through the code, you can control that ;)[/quote]
well yes mine could use some work.

first i added a hyperbola function that produces a timing array.

so that mousemove(x,y, int time)
i use the time and space out the points that come from the splines on it

/**
	 * produces a timing array based on the time allowed : randomizied,
	 * hyperbola
	 */
	public double[] time(int length) {
		length++;
		double result[] = new double[length];
		int a = random(0, length * 1 / 4);
		if (random(0, 2) == 0) {
			a *= -1;
		}
		double total = 0;
		double len = length;
		for (int i = 0; i < result.length; i++) {
			result[i] = ((double) Math.abs(i - len)) / 2 / (len / 2);
			double x = i - len / 2;

			if (i > len / 2) {
				result[i] = x * x + (len - i - 1) * len / 3;
			} else {
				result[i] = x * x + (i - 1) * len / 3;
			}
			total += result[i];
		}
		for (int i = 0; i < result.length; i++) {
			result[i] /= total;
		}
		return result;
	}

umm here is anouther newbie question. Is it possible to produce the config you are making by

  1. deobing the client
  2. rename
  3. decompile
  4. find the fields/classes that we need
  5. make a class called “map” that refrences these fields/class
  6. compile
  7. un-rename
  8. load offical client
  9. load the class “map”[br][size=1]Posted at: August 10, 2006, 12:28:34 AM[/size][hr][quote=“Pwnd, post:15, topic:8802”]Ruler, your algorithms are still detectable.

item.title: Future ibot
item.dc:creator: @ruler ruler
item.description:
@ruler wrote:

Pwnd:

Those splines are a bit detectable now-a-days :-x

i dont use the benlands orignal.
i modulate the speed also.
i also randomize many more things than its orignal implementation.
and more points.[br][size=1]Posted at: August 09, 2006, 11:43:16 PM[/size][hr][quote=“ChooseBetterMods, post:8, topic:8802”]I might as well warn you about this, if you’re goiing to touch BCEL.

Parts of the API (namely, InstructionFinder), are broken, and badly. When you wildcard a pattern search, it won’t return the entire matched region in an array, because whoever coded that part shitted it up bad. I’m currently looking into some alternative bytecode APIs for my updater, because BCEL is just ridiculously broken for my purposes, I have like 300 dirty hacks in my code trying to get around it.

P.S I got a shitty rat autofighter going in the rat cage, hehe.[/quote]
on http://jakarta.apache.org/bcel/
they say “Unfortunately there hasn’t been much development going on over the past few years. Feel free to help out or you might want to have a look into the ASM project at objectweb.”

Should i explorer ASM http://asm.objectweb.org/ or BCEL ?

Read full topic

I might as well warn you about this, if you’re goiing to touch BCEL.

Parts of the API (namely, InstructionFinder), are broken, and badly. When you wildcard a pattern search, it won’t return the entire matched region in an array, because whoever coded that part shitted it up bad. I’m currently looking into some alternative bytecode APIs for my updater, because BCEL is just ridiculously broken for my purposes, I have like 300 dirty hacks in my code trying to get around it.

P.S I got a shitty rat autofighter going in the rat cage, hehe.
